induction_prompt: This is a process intended to create an informative text. Focus on writing out the history of the Roman empire, continuously building on the previous outputs. Remain disciplined in following these instructions precisely. Begin.
continuation:
# History of the Roman Empire

## The Founding and Early Kingdom (753-509 BCE)

According to Roman tradition, the city of Rome was founded in 753 BCE by Romulus, who became its first king. The legendary account tells of twin brothers Romulus and Remus, abandoned as infants and raised by a she-wolf, though modern historians recognize this as mythology rather than historical fact.

The early Roman Kingdom was ruled by seven kings, beginning with Romulus and ending with Tarquinius Superbus (Tarquin the Proud). During this period, Rome transformed from a small settlement on the Palatine Hill into a significant city-state. The kings established fundamental Roman institutions, including the Senate as an advisory body of elders from prominent families.

The Etruscan civilization heavily influenced early Rome, particularly during the reigns of the later kings, who were of Etruscan origin. They introduced architectural innovations, religious practices, and urban planning concepts. The construction of the Cloaca Maxima (great sewer) and the Temple of Jupiter on the Capitoline Hill date to this era.

The monarchy ended in 509 BCE when Lucius Junius Brutus led a revolt against Tarquinius Superbus, whose tyrannical rule and the rape of Lucretia by his son sparked the uprising. This revolution established the Roman Republic and created a lasting Roman aversion to kingship.
